Level 3 maths and English

Level 3 maths and English payment breakdown on a 1 year programme
Level 3 maths and English payment

Supports delivery of maths and English to students on substantial level 3 study programmes (including T Levels) who have not yet attained a grade 9 to 4 GCSE or equivalent in either or both of these subjects.

 Payment per subject Instances per subject Total funded students Sub-total
Students on a 1 year eligible programme (less than 18 months) £375 0.00933 213 £743
Students on a 2 year eligible programme (18 months or more) £750 0.06512 213 £10,403
Total level 3 maths and English payment £11,146
More about level 3 maths and English payment

How proportion of students is calculated

Proportion of students is calculated using 2019 to 2020 student home postcodes from the autumn census 2020 and the index of multiple deprivation 2019. Details are in your allocation calculation toolkit.

Total low prior attainment in maths or English {% if scenario == '1' %}£103{% else %}£10,938{% endif %}
Where average weighting comes from

Average weighting is calculated using 2019 to 2020 data from the autumn census 2020. A student gets a weighting of 1 if they do not have grade 4, C or higher in GCSE maths or English. Those without both GCSEs get a weighting of 2.

Details are in your allocation calculation toolkit.

Disadvantage funding top up

If the total disadvantage funding for an institution
is less than £6,000, disadvantage funding
will be topped up to £6,000.

Top up to reach minimum amount £3,153

Discretionary bursary fund 2021 to 2022 £11,965
Where average weighting comes from

Average weighting is calculated using 2019 to 2020 data from the autumn census 2020 and the index of multiple deprivation 2019. Students are given a weighting for each funding element that is then averaged across total funded students.

Details are in your allocation calculation toolkit.

Adjusted discretionary bursary fund 2021 to 2022

From 2020 to 2021, the ESFA moved to a new methodology to calculate this fund. During the transition, you will receive between 50% and 150% of the amount you received in 2019 to 2020.

Total adjusted discretionary bursary fund breakdown
Adjusted discretionary bursary fund Sub-total
Discretionary bursary fund 2021 to 2022 £11,965
Discretionary bursary fund 2019 to 2020 £16,357
Lower limit 2021 to 2022 - 50% of 2019 to 2020 amount £8,178.50
Upper limit 2021 to 2022 - 150% of 2019 to 2020 amount £24,535.50
Exceptional adjustment £0
Adjusted discretionary bursary fund £11,965
